definition: zero/nought/zero sign/fractional/fragmentary/odd (of numbers)/(placed between two numbers to indicate a smaller quantity followed by a larger one)/fraction/(in mathematics) remainder (after division)/extra/to wither and fall/to wither
to break down/to break into pieces/fragmentary

sentences.english: When he tidied the room up, he put the odds and ends into a miscellaneous box.
sentences.chinese: 他收拾房間時，把七零八碎的東西全扔進雜物箱。

sentences.english: My hopes the wind done scattered.
sentences.chinese: 希望已被風吹得七零八碎。

sentences.english: We put all our odds and ends in(to) that drawer.
sentences.chinese: 我們把所有七零八碎的東西都放到那個抽屜裏了。

definition: same as 稀爛|稀烂[xi1 lan4]
see 百孔千瘡|百孔千疮[bai3 kong3 qian1 chuang1]
everything in disorder (idiom); in a hideous mess/at sixes and sevens
to suffer a crushing defeat (idiom)/in a pitiful state/in a complete mess/to roll (with laughter)
shapeless/deformed/ruined/beyond recognition/(of a person) reduced to a shadow
all split up and in pieces (idiom); disunity (in an organization)/complete lack of unity/to disintegrate/falling apart/to be at sixes and sevens
nothing remains the same (idiom); change beyond recognition
